department.dept_long_name: Department of Organismic and Evolutionary Biology

course.title: Phylogenomics, Comparative Genomics and Adaptation
course.description: This semester we will explore through readings of the recent literature the ways in which comparative genomics can inform phylogeny and genomic adaptation. In addition to surveying recent methods for harnessing thousands of loci for phylogenetic reconstruction, we will also study how comparing genomes of higher clades can reveal signatures of adaptation, particularly in the noncoding portion of the genome.
